dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, welcome back to the market minute! So, uh, big news from Wall Street, huh? The market really took a hit on Wednesday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, welcome back to the market minute! So, uh, big news from Wall Street, huh? The market really took a hit on Wednesday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock market continued to rally higher on Wednesday, as the S&P 500 hit a new record close and the Dow rose almost 500 points, with stocks now recovering most of their losses related to the coronavirus during the past two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Host_A, a pretty rough day, actually. The S&P 500, like, plunged to a new record low, and the Dow dropped almost 500 points.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Host_A, a pretty rough day, actually. The S and P five hundred, like, plunged to a new record low, and the Dow dropped almost five hundred points.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 index rose 1.1% on Wednesday, hitting a new record closing high of 3334.69... The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped nearly 500 points, gaining 1.7%...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that's after we saw those gains from, uh, what they called 'coronavirus excitement' just last week, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that's after we saw those gains from, uh, what they called coronavirus excitement just last week, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a huge sell-off on coronavirus fears last Friday when the Dow shed 600 points and posted its worst single-day drop since August 2019...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Most of those gains, like, gone now. It's almost like a whiplash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Most of those gains, like, gone now. It's almost like a whiplash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that bad news was, uh, compounded by that payroll report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that bad news was, uh, compounded by that payroll report.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Oh, absolutely. The ADP report. Private payrolls fell by like 291,000 in January. That's almost double what was expected!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. The A D P report. Private payrolls fell by like two hundred ninety one thousand in January. That's almost double what was expected!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a report from ADP and Moodys Analytics, which said that U.S. private payrolls rose by 291,000 in Januaryalmost twice the expected number...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Biggest monthly loss in five years, actually. Pretty grim stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Biggest monthly loss in five years, actually. Pretty grim stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the biggest monthly payroll gain in almost five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. But then, uh, the Nasdaq, it actually bucked the trend?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. But then, uh, the Nasdaq, it actually bucked the trend?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It did! Up 0.4%, thanks in large part to Tesla. Their shares, uh, they soared almost 20% on Wednesday, believe it or not.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It did! Up zero point four percent, thanks in large part to Tesla. Their shares, uh, they soared almost twenty percent on Wednesday, believe it or not.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Nasdaq Composite index, on the other hand, lagged both the Dow and S&P 500, gaining only 0.4%. The Nasdaq was held back in large part because Tesla shares... plunged by almost 20% on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, after plunging earlier in the week. So it's still down overall for the year, but that was a huge day for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, after plunging earlier in the week. So it's still down overall for the year, but that was a huge day for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Tesla shares, which soared up to 50% earlier this week... Even with Wednesdays record plunge, Tesla stock is still up more than 70% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Big day, yeah. But you know, when you look at the year-to-date, the S&P is actually negative now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Big day, yeah. But you know, when you look at the year-to-date, the S and P is actually negative now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 has now fully recovered from its coronavirus-related losses, turning positive for 2020 so far. The index is now up 1.2% for the year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. And the Nasdaq's down over four percent for 2020. So the Dow's the only one, like, still up for the year, barely?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. And the Nasdaq's down over four percent for twenty twenty. So the Dow's the only one, like, still up for the year, barely?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best-performing index so far is the Nasdaq, however, thanks to its 4.1% rise in 2020. The Dow, on the other hand, is attempting to climb back from earlier losses and turn positive for the year: It is now down 0.2% so far this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yup, just 0.2%. So, you know, it's a mixed bag, but the sentiment, uh, is definitely bearish.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yup, just zero point two percent. So, you know, it's a mixed bag, but the sentiment, uh, is definitely bearish.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow, on the other hand, is attempting to climb back from earlier losses and turn positive for the year: It is now down 0.2% so far this year. ... The bullish narrative thats been driving stocks since late 2019 is firmly back in control of the tape...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it all ties back to, of course, the coronavirus. The spread is, uh, still a major concern, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it all ties back to, of course, the coronavirus. The spread is, uh, still a major concern, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Almost 25,000 infected now. And as one analyst, Adam Crisafulli, put it, the 'bearish narrative' is firmly back in control.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Almost twenty five thousand infected now. And as one analyst, Adam Crisafulli, put it, the bearish narrative is firmly back in control.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of Wednesday, the disease has infected nearly 25,000 people and killed 490. Crucial quote: Stocks enjoyed another day of strong gains, Vital Knowledge founder Adam Crisafulli wrote in a note on Wednesday. The bullish narrative thats been driving stocks since late 2019 is firmly back in control of the tape...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So we should probably be watching for, like, the continued impact on global growth, especially for businesses tied to China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we should probably be watching for, like, the continued impact on global growth, especially for businesses tied to China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What to watch for: The coronavirus continuing impact on businesses, especially those with heavy exposure to China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. Travel restrictions, work stoppages... It's, uh, it's not looking great for the global economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. Travel restrictions, work stoppages... It's, uh, it's not looking great for the global economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The coronavirus-linked work stoppages and travel restrictions will have a material impact on global growth, Crisafulli recently predicted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a lot to unpack there, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a lot to unpack there, for sure.
